image.altText: Two credit card sized boxes with sexual health organisation logos, with an ultrasound probe cover in front.

props.synopsis: An independent review reveals a Canberra sexual health education organisation's mistaken distribution of more than 4,000 ultrasound probe covers as condoms was likely caused by an online ordering error.

title.children: Sexual health organisation's condom bungle caused by online ordering error

image.altText: Bruce looks serious as he walks through a throng of reporters, wearing suit and tie.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court will tomorrow decide whether Bruce Lehrmann can push ahead with his bid for an appeal against the findings in his failed defamation case against Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson.

title.children: Federal Court set to decide if Bruce Lehrmann allowed to appeal defamation case judgment

image.altText: Portrait of Shane Rattenbury sitting on a small wall with bushland down a mountain behind him.

props.synopsis: The ACT election saw the Greens go from six seats in the Legislative Assembly to three, with a fourth possible, but the swing against them was smaller than it appeared with the result being the party's third-best in ACT history.

title.children: ACT Greens still have 'very strong base' despite losing nearly half their Legislative Assembly seats

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks into multiple microphones.

props.synopsis: Re-elected MLA Jeremy Hanson says the party's seventh-straight election loss was "very disappointing", as conversations continue about Elizabeth Lee's leadership.

title.children: Jeremy Hanson confirms he will make bid for Canberra Liberals leadership, says the party has 'gone backwards'

image.altText: People walking across a courtyard surrounded by buildings.

props.synopsis: Vice-chancellor Stephen Parker says the University of Canberra is "spending beyond its means" and needs to save about $50 million in recurrent expenditure by the end of next year.

title.children: University of Canberra to cut 200 jobs as part of 'urgent and significant' cost-saving measures

image.altText: King Charles III chats with owner of alpaca.

props.synopsis: King Charles III and Queen Camilla have landed in Australia's capital as they begin their second official day of royal engagements.

title.children: King Charles III and Queen Camilla greet alpaca, given Tim Tams in Canberra as protester arrested

image.altText: Cages at a dog pound.

props.synopsis: Pet owners are urged to protect their dogs from the deadly parvovirus by keeping their vaccinations up to date.

title.children: 'A horrible disease': Queanbeyan Pound euthanases 21 dogs after outbreak of canine parvovirus

image.altText: Mick Gentleman looking sombre.

props.synopsis: While the ACT election has been called in favour of Labor, the exact make-up of the next Legislative Assembly isn't yet certain and there is one seat still up for grabs.

title.children: One seat still in doubt in ACT election as Greens claim third

image.altText: Edith Chow reads a map on her bike

props.synopsis: With entrants describing it as a treasure hunt race or chess on wheels, the Australian Mountain Bike Orienteering Championships in Canberra attracted more than 200 participants of all ages and abilities over the weekend.

title.children: 'Like chess on wheels': How mountain bike orienteering is breaking new ground

image.altText: Composite image showing Charlie Stevens and Dhirren Randhawa.

props.synopsis: The teenager who struck and killed South Australian Police Commissioner Grant Steven's son at Schoolies celebrations last year has been handed a suspended sentence.

title.children: Teenager avoids jail over death of South Australian Police Commissioner's son in hit-and-run crash

image.altText: Two young school children walk towards school carrying colourful backpacks.

props.synopsis: The Australian Bureau of Statistics says the number of families in Australia has gone up by a million in a decade, but it is couples who are more likely to live without dependants.

title.children: Five graphs reveal how Australian families are working in 2024

image.altText: gold bar

props.synopsis: A modern-day gold rush has moved up a gear with the price of the precious metal breaking records, as observers, including the Reserve Bank deputy, warn broader financial markets may have gotten ahead of themselves.

title.children: Gold price goes 'a bit nuts' but have financial markets got ahead of themselves?

image.altText: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump looking at each other in election illustration

props.synopsis: The Central Park Five announce they're suing Donald Trump for defamation and Kamala Harris courts the Republican vote — here's the latest updates from the US election.

title.children: Walz says Trump 'spiralling' as former president hit with new lawsuit — the latest from the US election campaign

image.altText: Doongmabulla Springs

props.synopsis: Mining giant Adani has accused scientists of being used by anti-coal campaigners after they published new research highlighting risks of coal mining to the Doongmabulla Springs.

title.children: Adani launches attack on scientists who revealed evidence of mining risks to protected ancient springs

image.altText: baby formula being put into bottle

props.synopsis: The federal government will establish a mandatory code of conduct to oversee the way baby formula products are advertised in Australia.

title.children: New rules for baby formula advertisements aims to protect parents

image.altText: Close up of a woman and a young girl

props.synopsis: A Qantas flight from Perth to the Pilbara region was diverted to Geraldton due to a mechanical issue. A passenger onboard says they were "terrified" and called for aircraft used on the route to be replaced.

title.children: Passengers message loved ones during 'terrifying' Qantas flight in regional WA

image.altText: A man at a podium in an empty auditorium.

props.synopsis: Graduating students say a speech by former union boss Joe de Bruyn "took a hard-right turn" as he voiced anti-abortion views during a ceremony at the Australian Catholic University in Melbourne.

title.children: Students walk out during 'shocking' anti-abortion speech by former union boss at university graduation

image.altText: Girl with blurred face dancing in a red tutu with elaborate gold embroidery

props.synopsis: A dance teacher tells a court a teenager whose parents are accused of starving her was at risk of fractures if she jumped too much, but the parents refused her pleas to get medical assistance for their daughter.

title.children: Teacher who raised alarm about teen with 'wafer thin' arms says parents brushed off concerns

image.altText: Australian athletes arrive at the 2022 Commonwealth Games

props.synopsis: The Glasgow Games will feature just 10 sports and as a result the dreams of several athletes hoping to compete have now been dashed.

title.children: 'Regrettable': Bosses disappointed after major sports axed from 2026 Commonwealth Games

image.altText: Two feet stuck between two large boulders.

props.synopsis: Photographs have emerged of the remarkable rescue of Matilda Campbell, 23, who fell three metres into a rock crevice in the NSW Hunter Valley earlier this month.

title.children: Images show dramatic rescue of woman left hanging by feet for seven hours after attempt to retrieve phone

image.altText: woman smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: An inquest has been unable to find the cause of Cecilia Devine's death. The Newcastle woman's body was found in the NSW Blue Mountains.

title.children: $500k reward offered over death of woman found more than 200km from home

image.altText: Images of brain scans.

props.synopsis: Both these conditions are rising globally at a rapid rate and have a deep and profound impact on those diagnosed.

title.children: Genetic variants linked to ADHD and Parkinson's, Queensland led study on brain size finds

image.altText: A boy tackles another boy holding the football while playing a game

props.synopsis: When 11-year-old Henri was hit on the head by a basketball, it began a 12-month medical ordeal.

title.children: What happens when developing brains sustain a concussion

image.altText: LNP launch

props.synopsis: The Katter's Australian Party has clarified its strategy for changing Queensland's abortion laws, saying it wants to first amend them to mandate care for babies born alive.

title.children: Robbie Katter plans to amend Queensland abortion laws first, before repeal attempt

image.altText: Police tape over street

props.synopsis: Cars, tobacco and cash are seized as part of raids across Victoria linked to an organised crime syndicate that police investigators allege earned $30 million over 12 months selling illegal tobacco.

title.children: Lamborghini and 600,000 cigarettes seized as police lay federal charges in raids on illegal tobacco syndicate

image.altText: Bridge under construction

props.synopsis: Crews are working to rectify a "problem" identified during the ongoing construction of a new $786 million bridge north of Hobart, which has resulted in two parts of the structure not lining up — but the Tasmanian government is adamant it won't cause delays or cost money.

title.children: Bridgewater Bridge 'problem' won't cause delay or cost money, Tasmanian government says

props.synopsis: The settlements come as Scotland Yard reveals a further 60 people have come forward to police with allegations against Mohamed Al Fayed.

title.children: Harrods in talks with more than 250 people seeking compensation over former owner's sexual misconduct allegations

image.altText: A headshot of a man fixing his glasses with both hands.

props.synopsis: The provocative Australian documentarian talks us through his latest adventure.

title.children: After Kanye's anti-Semitic outbursts, John Safran decided to squat in one of the rapper's mansions

image.altText: A wide shot of a mass of concrete rubble alongside a destroyed building

props.synopsis: Israel's military says strikes on Syria have killed the person responsible for transactions funding Hezbollah through the Al-Qard Al-Hassan organisation.

title.children: Children among 18 killed in IDF strike near Beirut hospital as Blinken lands in Israel for ceasefire talks

image.altText: Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un

props.synopsis: Ukraine releases a video, allegedly taken by a Russian soldier, showing North Koreans collecting Russian military uniforms and equipment.

title.children: About 11,000 North Korean soldiers are being trained in Russia, Ukrainian officials claim

image.altText: Sean Combs, wearing a black jacket, looks neutrally off camera in front of plastered logos.

props.synopsis: Four men and three women join the list of accusers claiming they were assaulted by the hip hop mogul, with some claiming other entertainment figures were involved.

title.children: New 'Diddy' sex abuse lawsuits claim unnamed celebrities were involved in assaults

image.altText: A 'sold' real estate sign sits next to a white fence outside a home

props.synopsis: The minister throws her weight behind a Business Council proposal for states to replace stamp duties with land tax.

title.children: Stamp duty 'a bad tax' that distorts the market, housing minister says, welcoming shift to land tax

image.altText: A young woman standing by a tree.

props.synopsis: The body of mother-of-five Rehana Parvin was found on September 12 in a village in Ashulia, buried in the yard of a property next to a septic tank.

title.children: Body of missing Queensland woman found in Bangladesh, two months after her disappearance

image.altText: Frothy brown and white foam sits on the surface of a river near a large rock.

props.synopsis: The NSW pollution watchdog confirms the presence of chemicals believed to be associated with cancer and immune disorders at a riverside swimming and camping spot.

title.children: Regulator finds PFOS 'forever chemicals' at popular camping spot

image.altText: Anna Kendrick, right, looks to something off-screen while wearing a 70s outfit on a dating show set with Tony Hale, left.

props.synopsis: In her directorial debut, Woman of the Hour, Anna Kendrick convincingly shelves her comedic charm for something far darker – and it mostly pays off.

title.children: In 1978, a serial killer won a dating show. Anna Kendrick tells the story in a creepy new movie
